bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Roberto Sierra is an American composer. He studied at the University of Puerto Rico, the Conservatory of Puerto Rico, the Institute for Sonology in Utrecht, and the Hamburg Hochschule für Musik. In his music, Sierra combines European moderism with Latin American popular music and folk song.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Papers consist mainly of music and programs. Clippings, correspondence and other documents are also included. The collection should be considered partial, as Sierra is currently an active composer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Papers are divided into five series: I. Music; II. Programs; III. Clippings; IV. Correspondence; and V. Contracts, Documents and Awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included in this series are handwritten and printed scores of Sierra's orchestral and chamber music compositions. Published scores include notes and corrections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes concert programs and program notes from performances of Roberto Sierra's music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes news clippings and articles about Roberto Sierra and his music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence between Roberto Sierra and various organizations, including orchestras, organizers of music festivals, universities, and the media. There are a few personal letters included. Correspondence is in English, Spanish and French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The majority of this series includes contracts for composition commissions. Also included are financial documents, biographical notes about Sierra, and photocopies of his university degrees. Awards include a 2009 Grammy nomination and several other award certificates.
